When the boat arrived at the Atlantis port, Dinobot got off and
started to =
think about where Trelos could be held. As he went across
town, though, he =
didn't realize that the Pacificus population looked
at him fearfully. Thing=
s got complicated when he went through a
restricted area. The gate alarm we=
nt off, and Dinobot suddenly became
conscious of his situation. Police woul=
d be after him soon. Maybe that
was better this way...

--- In nbwrpg@yahoo=
groups.com, "Nic" <warriorazure@...> wrote:
>
> Dinobot arrived at a little=
 outpost that offered boat transportation.
> He transformed and went to the=
 operator.
> 
> Dinobot: [grunt] Greetings. I need to go to Atlantis.
> 
> =
Operator: Atlantis, eh? Well, you can take that boat t'ere, but you'd
> bet=
ter be waitin'. We won't do a trip with you alone, eh?
> 
> The raptor got =
insulted and clacked his left claw, without raising.
> 
> Dinobot: [Grunt] =
Why? Do you not trust my goodwill?
> 
> The covered threat did its effect.
=
> 
> Operator: Oh, um, no, sir. I didn' mean t'at at all. I's jus that it
>=
 costs a lot of energon, so we wait for s'more people before we go.
> 
> Di=
nobot fell silent as he understood. This planet was full of
> goody-twoshoe=
s maximals! That guy was being honest and scared!
> 
> Dinobot: Oh. My [gru=
nt] apologies. I shall wait on the boat then.
> 
> He walk onto the deck an=
d sat in a corner, keeping to himself. A few
> hours later, they left with =
more people aboard. They all looked like
> Rhinox did, he thought, only les=
s dangerous than him.
> 
> What the pit was going on here?
>
